Construction & Civil Engineering

Hearing Screening for Construction Sites

On-Site Hearing Testing for Construction & Civil Engineering Projects

Contact Us Today

Construction sites expose workers to high-impact and intermittent noise from power tools, heavy plant, demolition work, and groundworks. These sudden noise spikes significantly increase the risk of rapid hearing damage.

Our construction hearing screening service is built to work safely on active sites with minimal downtime.

Why Hearing Screening Matters on Construction Sites

Exceeds Safe Limits

Power tools and plant regularly exceed safe noise limits

Safety Critical

Hearing loss increases accident risk and miscommunication

HSE Compliance

Demonstrates compliance during HSE inspections

Safety-Critical Roles

Protects workers in safety-critical roles

Insurance & Audits

Supports insurance and audit requirements

What Happens During the Test

Noise-Exposure and PPE Usage Questionnaire

Understanding exposure history and protective equipment use

Ear Canal Inspection

Visual check for blockages or conditions

Audiometric Hearing Assessment

Comprehensive hearing level testing

Immediate Results with Guidance

Clear next-step guidance provided on-site

All testing is carried out using portable, calibrated equipment suitable for site conditions.

Who This Service Is For

Site Operatives

Groundworkers

Plant Operators

Demolition Teams

Site Managers

Construction Site Hearing Screening – FAQs

Yes. Construction sites frequently exceed safe noise levels, making hearing screening a key part of health surveillance.

Yes. We use portable, site-safe equipment and work around site operations.

Approximately 10–15 minutes per person.

Where possible, employees should avoid loud noise exposure for several hours before testing to ensure accurate results.

Hearing screening remains essential even when hearing protection is in place, as it verifies effectiveness.

Results are confidential. A refer result simply guides further assessment and protective measures.

Arrange Hearing Screening for Your Construction Site

Stay compliant and protect your team with professional on-site hearing tests for construction workers.
